result.execSummary:
The defendant Hannah R Day was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations, excluding restitution, are to be paid within 6 months
Restitution is to be paid within 60 days

The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 7 days. 
NO CONTACT WITH ASHLAND WALMART
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

timeConds.notes:
Granted Work Release
Zero Credit for Time Served.
Defendant to contact the Ashland County Jail within 7 days to set up time to begin serving sentence.

Defendant may replace jail time with 160 hours of uncompensated community service. If the Defendant selects the community service option she must complete the community service in its entirety within the first 4 months of probation. Partial credit will not be given. The Defendant must provide written proof of successful completion of community service to the Court, the Ashland County Jail, the Department of Corrections, and the Ashland County District Attorney's office on the letterhead for the nonprofit agency for whom the community service is performed prior to the scheduled jail start date to avoid the jail time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Hannah R Day in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement plea to count WH sent prob, restitition to Walmart $198.44, 20 days ACJ or 160 CS completed within 4 months from today proof on letterhead, Ct, Jail, DA, NC with Walmart Ashland, Couns, $10 fine, DNA. Atty Hoffmann/Def state this is the agreement. Def plea NC. Ct accepts plea and finds def Guilty. State has complied with vic rights. DA comments on expunction-expunction is not part of agreement, def admitted theft of approx $2000. Atty Hoffmann comments. Ct comments, judgment WH 12mo prob, rest $198.44 Walmart-PIF 60 days, report DOC 24hrs, 20 days jail work release, zero CTS contact jail w/in 7 days to set up jail time/DNA.OR 4 mo 160 hrs CS as outlined in Offer to Settle or serve by 2/19/17 9am. NC with Walmart Ashland, Couns, $499.38 Pay in full 6 mo.
